Definition at line 83 of file RRsrcMgr.h.

const UPath& RRsrcMgr::GetRecentScriptName (  )  const [inline]

returns the script currently being parsed (or the last script parsed). This is available mainly so that parsers know the name of the file they're parsing.

Definition at line 53 of file RRsrcMgr.h.

bool RRsrcMgr::LoadScript ( const UPath &  fileName,
const tstring &  defKeyword,
tstring &  errors 
)

loads a script file. The default keyword is used if a keyword is not present. Returns true on success. If noScriptName is false, then the name of the script file will be prepended to the name of each resource created. The script file name and the resource name will be separated with a ':'.

create the array table.

note that we cannot create file local variables, so we can simply grab a const reference to the global variable table.

ensure that a default keyword was specified.

read in the file data and pass it to the lexer.

return an error if we could not load!

get the file data.

create a lexer to build the token stream.

go through each token and determine what kind of resource needs to be created.

we have an array.

loop again.

we have a keyword.

no keyword specified, so assume the default keyword.

set the recent script name and create the resource.

Create the resource.

make sure we don't keep a copy of the file's data around.

build the error message.

set the output string.

make sure we don't keep a copy of the file's data around.

success!
